moves.1. f4:
I was black playing this game in the North Essex league club KO competition.
Oh! What's this? When did I last see Bird's openning in a match?
moves.1... e6: Without the benefit of Gameknot's openning data base I choose one of black's poorer alternatives....
moves.2. Nf3 Nf6 3. e3 b6 4. Be2 Bb7: So whaite has control of e5, but I have e4 as compensation.
moves.5. O-O d5 6. b3 Bd6: Starting to contest e5 and discouraging f5 from white.
moves.7. Bb2 Nbd7 8. Ne5 c6 9. Qe1 Qc7: Now I can capture on e5
moves.10. d4: White builds the strong e5 so I can't take, but blocks the action of his bishop on b2.
moves.12. Rc1 Qe7: I really don't like the idea of castling on either side now.
moves.13. a4: Not sure what white's thinking was behind this move. At least my not castling is preventing his whole-hearted K-side attack.
moves.15. Qh4 Qf8: A tough decision after thinking for too long and now I'm getting into time trouble.
moves.16. Qh3: Perhaps not the strongest for white, but I beed to be careful of the attack on c8.
moves.16... Rc7: Defending f7 and removing the R from potential attack by white's queen.
moves.17. c4 c5: c4 was a long time coming and I need to respond in kind otherwise my position is lost.
moves.18. cxd5 Bxd5 19. Bb5+ Kd8 20. Nc4 g5: Now that my bishops are finally active I can counterattack on the King's side.
moves.21. Nfe5 gxf4 22. Rxf4: Taking with the pawn would be better for White, with the aim of openning the central files for attack on my king.
moves.22... cxd4: Surely a mistake by black? but only 5 minutes left to the time control. Also white's rook on c1 is not defended so the c4 knight is pinned.
moves.26... f6: Now my knight is also unpinned and the 7th rank is available.
moves.27. a5 Bc5 28. axb6 Bxb6 29. Bxb6 axb6 3: Playing on instinct, black easily makes the time control with nearly 60 secs to spare.
moves.31. Nxb6: White wins a pawn, and can remove the strong bishop on d5 next move...but a what cost?
moves.31... Ra7: Does white have an answer to this move? I haven't found one.
moves.32. Ra4: This was certainly not it! He needed to maintain the defence on g2, but if 32.Rc2 then black plays Ra1+ followed by 33....Rx+ on c1 if white interposes either the N or R. Or if white plays 33.Rf1 then Nf3+ wins the queen. 32.Rf2 is no better.
moves.32... Nf3+: and white resigns being mated next move.
